sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The pandemic curbed the crowds, but celebrations across the world still took place to welcome the arrival of the new year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The pandemic tops the list of concerns for most world leaders, while Russia concentrates on security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Anti-apartheid campaigner Archbishop Desmond Tutu has been laid to rest in Cape Town after he died age 90 last week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The world has been saying goodbye to 2021 after a year of dealing with a global pandemic that's still raging as we go into 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the Russian capital Moscow, there were the usual spectacular display of fireworks, but not the regular crowds in Red Square, as Covid restrictions continue to limit celebrations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The festivities in Greece were also limited to lighting up the sky, after the health minister banned music as the country copes with the surge in cases.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the German capital, even the fireworks were more muted this year, although the sky did come alive around Berlin's Brandenburg Gate to welcome in the coming year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Normally tens of thousands of people would be there to celebrate, but at present mass gatherings are forbidden by the government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As usual, the Eiffel Tower took centre stage in Paris, but with few crowds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: French President Emmanuel Macron expressed hope for 2022 on Friday, as the country registered an unprecedented 232,000 new Covid cases.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But despite rapidly rising cases in Spain, around 7,000 people did gather in Madrid's Puerta del Sol for a fireworks display, eating grapes as tradition dictates and dancing to the rhythm of the clock's chimes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The annual spectacular light show in Sydney went ahead despite the city being at the centre of a surge in cases. Crowds were far smaller than in pre-pandemic years when as many as one million revellers would pile into the city centre. But crowds were in evidence in Taiwan as people gathered at the 101 skyscraper in the capital Taipei on Friday night to bring in the new year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A spectacular display in Bangkok too late on Friday as 2021 drew to an end in Thailand.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: New Year's Eve prayers, which are usually held in Buddhist temples around the country, were held online instead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And the sky lit up from Jibai's Burj Khalifa, the world's tallest tower, as the clock struck midnight in the United Arab Emirates.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Along with the fireworks, the other thing all countries have in common is hoping for a better year in 2022. In the Roman Catholic calendar, January the 1st is dedicated to world peace, and Pope Francis has used the occasion to praise the role of women as peacemakers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Addressing a mass in St. Peter's Basilica, Francis said mothers know how to overcome obstacles and disagreements and to install peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: How much violence there is against women, he continued, enough.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: To hurt a woman is to outrage God, who created humanity from a woman.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Tweeting before the Mass, the Pope said a more peaceful world starts from the hearts of individuals and relationships in the family, and from there builds all the way up to relationships between peoples and nations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As New Year's Eve celebrations took place around the globe, world leaders were referring to the pandemic that's led to the smaller crowds this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Germany, the new leader emphasized the need to go forward with the vaccine effort.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We know that those who have not yet been vaccinated are particularly at risk of contracting the disease and suffering long and severe illness.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I therefore appeal to you once again, get vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In the French capital, President Emmanuel Macron had a similar message.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Vaccination is our surest ace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It strongly reduces transmission.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It divides by ten the number of severe forms of the illness.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is why, again, I appeal to the five million people who aren't vaccinated to undertake this simple gesture for you, your compatriots, for our country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: All of France is counting on you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: All of France is counting on you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And in London, the UK Prime Minister added his voice to the appeals to get jabbed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And I want to speak directly to all those who have yet to get fully vaccinated, the people who think the disease can't hurt them. Look at the people going into hospital now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: That could be you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: From China, where the pandemic began, Xi Jinping wanted to talk of his country's effort to stem the virus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Up until now, China has provided 2 billion COVID vaccine doses to more than 120 countries and international groups.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But in Russia, Vladimir Putin chose to concentrate on security and politics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We have firmly and consistently defended our national interests, the security of the country and its citizens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We have promptly restored the economy and we are approaching implementation of strategic development goals. Of course, there are plenty of unsolved issues, but we have overcome this year in a dignified way." The new year has begun like the last one, under the shadow of Covid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The new year has begun like the last one, under the shadow of Covid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In France, the wearing of masks outdoors has become obligatory once again in city centres.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: With the infection rate running at over 200,000 cases per day, many residents are resigned to the return of the measure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It doesn't bother me, says this resident of Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We've already been through this last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We're in the middle of a peak, so I really don't have any issue with this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It will last for a few weeks. I think we can all make the effort.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We know this is going to go on for a few more years, so I support collective effort.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Big New Year's Eve celebrations were cancelled in Austria, with the closing time in restaurants brought forward to 10pm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Vaccination is expected to be made compulsory from next month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Israel has finally got going with its fourth vaccination campaign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The measure had been approved in principle several weeks ago, but health authorities held fire on implementation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The country has also taken delivery of Pfizer's anti-COVID pills.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In Indonesia, meanwhile, the government's adopted a strategy of closing down major roads as a way of reducing the circulation of the population, in the hope that the measure will also reduce the circulation of the virus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's 20 years since the Euro was introduced. The banknotes and coins came into circulation in 12 countries on January 1, 2002. The currency has survived initial doubts, price concerns and a debt crisis that spread across the region. The Euro is now used by 340 million people in 19 nations, from Ireland to Germany to Slovakia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the US, at least seven people were injured after a terrifying wildfire ripped through a neighborhood in Colorado. The blaze, whipped up by strong winds, destroyed buildings in

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: its path, with officials fearing at least 500 homes may have been destroyed. Authorities said it was remarkable that no one was killed and there are no reports of anyone missing after the fire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In South Africa, mourners have been attending the funeral service for Archbishop Desmond Tutu who died on Boxing Day. His coffin was carried up the aisle by his grandchildren.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The service was led by the Archbishop of Cape Town, Thabo Magoba, and the Dean of St. George's Cathedral, Michael Weider.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The famed anti-apartheid campaigner had requested a simple wooden coffin and a white carnation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Mourners included South Africa's President, Cyril Ramaphosa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: If Archbishop Desmond Tutu were here, he would have said, Hey, hey, why are you looking so glum, so unhappy?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He would have wanted to elicit a smile, a laughter from amongst all of us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: That was the type of person that he was.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Tutu was 90 years old when he died last week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He'll be interred behind the pulpit of the cathedral where he preached for many years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A tireless activist, he won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1984 for combating white minority rule in his country. He'll also be remembered for his continually positive outlook on life and happy, expressive nature.
